Key Match Events: India won the match by four wickets.
Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 82 off 53 balls.
Haris Rauf took 2 wickets for 36 runs.
Mohammad Nawaz took 2 wickets for 42 runs.
Shan Masood scored 52 not out off 42 balls.
Hardik Pandya took 3 wickets for 30 runs.
Arshdeep Singh took 3 wickets for 32 runs.
Ravichandran Ashwin hit the winning run.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam praised his bowlers and credited Kohli for finishing the game and shifting the momentum.
India captain Rohit Sharma called Kohli's innings the best he has played for India.
Virat Kohli expressed his disbelief and gratitude, calling it a special moment and possibly his best T20 innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan only used five bowlers, and the decision to leave Mohammad Nawaz's final over of spin until the last will be one that will haunt Babar Azam for a long time.
Kohli looked close to tears as he was swamped by his teammates after the match.
The game was described as having everything, with volcanic joy for India and devastation for Pakistan.
